title: Gemini - Champion Concept
body:
Champion Name: Gemini 
Pronunciation: (GEM-IN-EYE) 
 
Short Champion Summary: 
She was originally meant to just be a mage; but as I got further into designing her, I wanted Gemini to be able to play more than just the one role. Her kit gives so much utility that she could be an aggressive support or even a sustain top lane. 
 
Champions Statistics: 

Base Health: 495 Health 
Health Regeneration: 6.7 Health Regeneration per 5 Seconds 
Base Mana: 260 Mana
Mana Regeneration: 5.8 Mana Regeneration per 5 Seconds
Attack Damage: 50 Attack Damage 
Attack Speed: 0.640 Attack Speed 
Armor: 18 Armor 
Magic Resistance: 30 Magic Resistance 
Movement Speed: 330 Movement Speed 
 
Champions Passive(s), and Ability(s): 

**Passive: **
Gemini can hold up to 3 gems safely; however in total can hold up to 5 gems. With each additional gem after 3, Gemini loses movement speed drastically. For each gem, Gemini holds she gains increased magic damage. Gemini can only have a maximum of 3 gems on the field at once.
 
Increased Magic Damage: 4/5/6% Increased Magic Damage 
Reduced Movement Speed: 20% per Gem 


**Ability One:**
Fire Gem: 
Gemini can either place the Fire Gem on herself or in the field of battle. If the gem is placed on herself she gains magic damage on her auto attack which deal damage over time. If the gem is placed in the field of battle, it deals magic damage to all nearby enemies. Gemini can pick up the gem at any time by right-clicking on it. If Gemini is holding a fire gem already the cooldown is halved and she loses the fire gem she is holding. 
 
Casted on herself: 
Magic Damage: 5/7/9/11/13 Magic Damage per Second per Gem 
 
Casted in field: 
Gem Health: 4 Hits 
Magic Damage: 35/55/75/95/115 Magic Damage per Second + (0.1 AP) 
Ability Range: 450 Units 
Gem Range: 175 Units 
Mana Cost: 50/60/70/80/90 Mana 
Cool Down: 8/7/6/5/4 Seconds 


**Ability Two:**
Earth Gem: 
Gemini can either place the Earth Gem on herself or in the field of battle. If the gem is placed on herself she gains increased armor and magic resistance. If the gem is placed in the field of battle, it snares the nearest enemy champion. Gemini can pick up the gem at any time by right-clicking on it. If Gemini is holding a Earth Gem already the cooldown is halved and she loses the Earth Gem she is holding. 
 
Casted on herself: 
Increased Armor: 5/7/9/11/13 Armor per Gem 
Increased Magic Resistance: 5/7/9/11/13 Armor per Gem 
 
Casted in Field: 
Gem Health: 4 Hits 
Magic Damage: 65/85/115/155/205 Magic Damage + (0.3 AP) 
Snare Duration: 1.5 Seconds 
Ability Range: 450 Units 
Gem Range: 175 Units 
Mana Cost: 50/60/70/80/90 Mana 
Cool Down: 8/7/6/5/4 Seconds 


**Ability Three:** 
Air Gem: 
Gemini can either place the Air Gem on herself or in the field of battle. If the gem is placed on herself she gains increased movement speed, and her first attack will slow the target. If the gem is placed in the field of battle, it reveals all stealthed targets and removes debuffs from any nearby allied champions. Gemini can pick up the gem at any time by right-clicking on it. If Gemini is holding a Air Gem already the cooldown is halved and she loses the Air Gem she is holding. 
 
Casted on herself: 
Increased Movement Speed: 2/4/6/8/10% Movement Speed per Gem 
Slow Amount: 20/25/30/35/40% Slow 
Slow Duration: 1.25 Seconds 
 
Casted in Field: 
Gem Health: 4 Hits 
Ability Range: 450 Units 
Gem Range: 300 Units 
Mana Cost: 50/60/70/80/90 Mana 
Cool Down: 8/7/6/5/4 Seconds 


**Ultimate Ability:**
Gemini explodes all her gems, dealing magic damage to all targets wherever her gems are bound too. Gemini loses all gems she is holding and the ones that are placed on the field. 
 
Magic Damage: 60/100/140 Magic Damage per Gem + (0.2 AP) 
Explosion Radius: 200 Units 
Mana Cost: 100/110/120 Mana 
Cool Down: 120/105/90 Seconds 
 
Why I think this champion is unique: 
There are so many different options on how you can play, and react with Gemini. She can be played as a sustain, support, mage, possibly even in the jungle. Best part about her is she has so much outplay potential but she would be very difficult to play.

I'm pretty sure sweeping lens has 600 range and reveals invisible wards, and yet people still buy it over upgraded yellow trinket.

Sure, the 100 gold worth item has a huge range, but having a pink ward every 8-4 seconds is really OP, not even green wards from upgraded 200 gold yellow trinket recharge this fast.

I think to use it to counter roam-invisibility champs like Shaco and Twitch (just get close to Evelynn), you'd need to stack it twice.

If it needs a buff, I'd recommend letting the gems come in charges, like a secondary bar instead of mana, and making her able to sacrifice extra gems to bypass cooldowns (activating early removes an extra gem per 2 seconds or something, out of the maximum of 10 gems, idk) for those sub-optimal yet versatile counters to champion abilities. This would let her be like Taric except more outrageous, allowing her to burst by spamming fire until she goes OOG (out of gems), then she'd be super vulnerable.

Here's what I think:
- Because you cannot hold the 2 or more of the same crystals, you can only hold 3 crystals, meaning you don't need a slow debuff for holding more than 3 crystals.
- You should probably make the Earth Gem snare everything in its range as snaring the nearest champion just feels insignificant.
- Try a recharging system for the Earth Gem so it can snare again instead of being a rock.
- I think you should allow gems to be latched onto allies and enemies to maximize Gemini's kit and give her a more supporting role.
- Would the ultimate cause multiple explosions around your character if you were holding 2 or 3 gems?
- Why not try a large decaying movement speed boost when the Air Gem is applied?

If you do or don't like this ideas, just say so, it's all to make a better champion. :)
